subject: The CNN Political Ticker PM, Friday, April 13, 2007
body:
CNN.com - CNN Political Ticker










For the latest, breaking political news, check for updates
throughout the day on the CNN Political Ticker
http://www.cnn.com/ticker All politics, all the
time.

Programming note: Watch
American Morning Monday as former Sen. John Edwards and his
wife Elizabeth discuss his presidential bid and her cancer
battle with CNN's John Roberts. 


Today on
the Ticker

Cheney's former chief of
staff skips motion for new trial, will appeal

WASHINGTON (CNN) -- Attorneys for Vice President Cheney's
former chief of staff Lewis "Scooter" Libby have decided
against filing a motion for a new trial and plan instead to
challenge his convictions on appeal, according to documents
filed Friday in Federal court.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/04/cheneys-former-chief-of-staff-skips.html

***

While House: Potentially five million e-mails
are lost

WASHINGTON (CNN) -- With the White
House already facing sharp questions about whether top
presidential advisers improperly used a Republican National
Committee e-mail server to send messages that later
disappeared, spokeswoman Dana Perino acknowledged Friday that
millions of White House e-mails also may have disappeared.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/04/while-house-potentially-five-million-e.html

***

Rove's attorney says there was a 'gap' in
White House e-mail records

WASHINGTON (CNN)
-- Robert Luskin, personal attorney for senior White House aide
Karl Rove, told CNN Friday that he "has no reason to doubt" an
assertion last year by the special prosecutor in the CIA leak
case that some White House e-mail was missing.

Full
story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/04/roves-attorney-says-there-was-gap-in.html

***

Justice releases nearly 2,400 pages of
documents, saying it is being responsive to Hill
demands

WASHINGTON (CNN) -- The Justice
Department on Friday provided nearly 2,400 pages of internal
documents involving the controversial firing of eight U.S.
attorneys, declaring it is being responsive to the demands of
congressional Democrats for further document production.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/04/justice-releases-nearly-2400-pages-of.html

***

GOP presidential candidate defends Imus, slams
Jackson and Sharpton

WASHINGTON (CNN) --
Republican Presidential candidate Mike Huckabee defended
embattled radio talk-show host Don Imus during a radio
interview Friday, saying that if Imus deserves to be fired,
several other talk-show hosts do as well.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/04/gop-presidential-candidate-defends.html

***

Bush backs Wolfowitz amid scandal

WASHINGTON (CNN) -- President Bush expects World Bank chief
Paul Wolfowitz to stay in his job, despite a probe by the
organization's board into whether he violated rules by
promoting his girlfriend to a higher-paying job without board
approval, a White House spokeswoman said Friday.

Full
story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/04/bush-backs-wolfowitz-amid-scandal.html

***

Giuliani camp touts financial health

WASHINGTON (CNN) -- Former Mayor Rudy Giuliani's
presidential campaign touted its fundraising efforts in the
first three months of 2007 and the campaign's overall financial
health in a conference call Friday with the national media.
Giuliani reported raising $14.7 million, from 28,356 donors.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/04/giuliani-camp-touts-financial-health.html

***

Romney releases full fundraising
numbers

WASHINGTON (CNN) -- Former
Massachusetts Gov. Mitt Romney released a complete accounting
of his first quarter presidential fundraising totals Friday,
reporting that he had raised $20.7 million from 32,074
individuals.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/04/romney-releases-full-fundraising.html

***

The Hollywood Primary: Giuliani wins Ben Stein's
money

WASHINGTON (CNN) -- The race for
Hollywood cash has focused mainly on the Democratic
presidential hopefuls so far, but that hasn't stopped
Republican presidential candidate Rudy Giuliani from staking a
small claim on the entertainment industry's largesse.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/04/hollywood-primary-giuliani-wins-ben.html

***

Bushes report earning $642,905 in
2006

WASHINGTON (CNN) -- The White House
released President and Mrs. Bush's annual tax returns Friday,
reporting their taxable income last year at $642,905.

Consequently, the Bush's paid a total of $186,378 in
federal income taxes.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/04/bushes-report-earning-642905-in-2006.html

****

Cheneys report earning $1,614,862 in
2006

WASHINGTON (CNN) -- Vice President Dick
Cheney and his wife Lynn reported a taxable income of
$1,614,862 in 2006, leading them to pay $413,326 in income
taxes, the White House said Friday.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/04/cheneys-report-earning-1614862-in-2006.html

***

Doctor: Corzine suffered 'severe
trauma'

WASHINGTON (CNN) -- New Jersey Gov.
Jon Corzine remains in "critical but stable condition" after
his involvement in a car accident Thursday night, Dr. Steven
Ross of Coopers University Medical Center said in a press
coherence Friday.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/04/doctor-corzine-suffered-severe-trauma.html

***

McCain fires back on Edwards
criticisms

WASHINGTON (CNN) -- Sen. John
McCain's, R-Arizona, presidential campaign fired back Friday at
former Sen. John Edwards, D-North Carolina, who criticized
McCain for his continued support for military involvement in
Iraq.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/04/mccain-fires-back-on-edwards.html

***

'D.C. madam' names a purported customer

WASHINGTON (CNN) -- The alleged "D.C. madam" dropped a
name in court documents filed Thursday, but the man named
laughed at being accused of hiring the high-end escort service
run by Deborah Jeane Palfrey.

Full
story:http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/04/dc-madam-names-purported-customer.html

***

Bush: Resist 'temptation to manipulate
life'

WASHINGTON (AP) -- President Bush, at
the national Catholic prayer breakfast, stressed his opposition
to easing restrictions on federally funded embryonic stem cell
research, a reference to a bill he's threatened to veto.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/04/bush-resist-temptation-to-manipulate.html

***

Snow to deliver commencement address at
Catholic University/

WASHINGTON (CNN) --
White House Press Secretary Tony Snow, who took a leave of
absence from his post in late March when it was determined his
cancer had returned, will deliver the commencement address at
the Catholic University of America on May 12, the university
announced Thursday.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/04/snow-to-deliver-commencement-address.html
